scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Henry John May Papers consist of May's autobiography which chronicles his career as an author and lawyer in South Africa. May began to practice law in Johannesburg in 1925 and was considered an authority on native law and customs. He wrote and lectured on apartheid, constitutional law and South African history. May's autobiography describes his personal life as well as his professional accomplishments.
